Nikkel Mollenhauer

IT-Systems Engineering Student @HPI

file_download CV | | | Contact

About me

Hi, I'm Nikkel, currently studying towards my bachelor's degree in IT-Systems Engineering at the Hasso-Plattner-Institute in Potsdam. I'm always open to learn and try out new things, but am especially interested in machine learning, CI/CD and everything that makes workflows more efficient! In autumn of 2022, I joined the Site Reliability team of the Azure cloud platform at Microsoft Dublin, where I was responsible for extending monitoring functionalities for a number of core Azure services.

In 2014 my family and I moved from my hometown of Kiel, Germany to Varese in northern Italy, where I lived until my graduation from the European School of Varese in Summer 2019. In 2017 I had the opportunity to do an internship in San Francisco, California, where I learnt about the "Silicon Valley Mindset" and a new way of working collaboratively. In 2019 I started studying towards my Bachelor's degree in IT-Systems Engineering at the Hasso-Plattner-Institute in Potsdam, Germany, which I intend to finish in Summer 2023.

I have recently submitted my bachelor thesis "Monitoring of Agents for Dynamic Pricing in different Recommerce Markets" (which can be found here), which is based on my bachelor's project run in cooperation with Feather by SAP, "Online Marketplace Simulation: A Testbed for Self-Learning Agents" (here), which I worked on together with a small group of other students.

About me

Hi, I'm Nikkel, currently studying towards my bachelor's degree in IT-Systems Engineering at the Hasso-Plattner-Institute in Potsdam. I'm always open to learn and try out new things, but am especially interested in machine learning, CI/CD and everything that makes workflows more efficient! In autumn of 2022, I joined the Site Reliability team of the Azure cloud platform at Microsoft Dublin, where I was responsible for extending monitoring functionalities for a number of core Azure services.

In 2014 my family and I moved from my hometown of Kiel, Germany to Varese in northern Italy, where I lived until my graduation from the European School of Varese in Summer 2019. In 2017 I had the opportunity to do an internship in San Francisco, California, where I learnt about the "Silicon Valley Mindset" and a new way of working collaboratively. In 2019 I started studying towards my Bachelor's degree in IT-Systems Engineering at the Hasso-Plattner-Institute in Potsdam, Germany, which I intend to finish in Summer 2023.

I have recently submitted my bachelor thesis "Monitoring of Agents for Dynamic Pricing in different Recommerce Markets" (which can be found here), which is based on my bachelor's project run in cooperation with Feather by SAP, "Online Marketplace Simulation: A Testbed for Self-Learning Agents" (here), which I worked on together with a small group of other students.
